summary: REQ-28 appears implemented via a mobile sticky header wrapper on DashboardPage keeping the header/Add Entry button visible with background/spacing/z-index. REQ-30 appears implemented by introducing a shared response status style helper and applying it to badges in the Recent Posts table and Follow-up reminders. REQ-29 is only partially evidenced: copy logic exists, but the required explicit "Copy to Clipboard" button placement/labeling and disabled-on-empty behavior are not clearly shown, and the code currently shows an error toast instead of disabling the button.

missing_requirements.requirement: Each of the 3 hook template cards shows a button labeled "Copy to Clipboard" in the card header area next to the hook title.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows a handleCopy function but the truncated file excerpt does not show any per-card header UI including a button with the exact label "Copy to Clipboard" placed next to the hook title.

missing_requirements.requirement: If the template content is empty/whitespace, the "Copy to Clipboard" button is disabled and the app does not attempt to copy.
missing_requirements.reason: The shown handleCopy implementation checks for empty content and triggers a toast error, but there is no evidence the button is disabled; additionally the flow still allows a user action that results in an error message rather than a disabled control.

missing_requirements.requirement: Tapping "Copy to Clipboard" copies the corresponding template content using the existing clipboard flow.
missing_requirements.reason: The implementation uses navigator.clipboard.writeText directly; there is no evidence it reuses an existing app clipboard utility/flow (if one exists).

hallucinated_features.description: Anonymous-mode support / refactor of authorization and query enabling behavior (e.g., "anonymous-capable" actor, isReadyForQueries true in anonymous mode).
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest is strictly about sticky header, copy buttons, and status badge colors; auth/anonymous-mode changes are not requested and are listed as changes in the diff summary text.

hallucinated_features.description: Global visual theme/palette and Tailwind configuration updates (OKLCH neutral palette, typography/spacing/shadows).
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by REQ-28/29/30; appears as additional styling/theme work mentioned in the diff summary file list.
